summary: This document is email correspondence between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York regarding drafting a letter in response to a defense motion, as directed by Judge Alison Nathan. The emails discuss procedural matters, redaction concerns for non-parties, and coordination with defense counsel.

persons.name: Manley
persons.context: Recipient of a letter being drafted by the government; appears to be defense counsel in the case.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge who directed a meet-and-confer process regarding document production and redactions in the case.

connections.description: Government prosecutor corresponding with defense counsel regarding case procedures and document production as ordered by the court.
Prosecutors are following judicial orders from Judge Nathan regarding the meet-and-confer process on document redactions.

events.title: Email Correspondence on Draft Letter
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys exchange emails drafting a letter in response to a defense motion, coordinating to meet Judge Nathan's directive for a meet-and-confer.

locations.name: Southern District of New York
locations.context: Jurisdiction where the case is being prosecuted.

locations.name: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
locations.context: Address of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The government is drafting a letter in response to a defense motion as part of a court-ordered meet-and-confer process directed by Judge Alison Nathan.
Prosecutors express concern about entertaining redaction requests from non-parties who are neither witnesses nor victims, fearing it could lead to a high volume of similar requests.
The correspondence shows coordination between government attorneys to finalize and send a draft to defense counsel, with the aim of filing it the following day.
